SENT.plain: Ventricular allorhythmia is an electrocardiogram feature leading to a pattern of "regularly irregular" arrhythmia mainly reported during non-life-threatening organized atrial tachycardia
We report the infrequent case of a patient presenting with ventricular allorhythmia during infarct-related ventricular tachycardia
The potential mechanisms of this tachycardia are discussed
